values:
you know, ive been thinking about this a lot.  i dont think people my age are really meant for marriage.  i dont know of one marriage or engagement that has worked out with people my age.  a few engagements have broken, including my own.  and marriages have plumbeted into a horrible abbys of broken dreams and hopes.  and why do these relationships end?  a whole bunch of reasons.  entering a engagement before both are ready, wanting to get married, people changing, blind love, being too young, not mature enough, and of course the typical- bitchy mean controlling mothers (yes, it has happened to other people, too).

so what do we do in response to all of this?  become bitter, commitaphobes who are too afraid to ever trust again or let someone love them.  and throughout all of this, im not cynical.  honestly not.  someday i want to get married.  yes, i do.  but trust me- not for a frickin long time.  this past engagement cost my dad so much money.  and the ass wasnt mature enough to pay my dad back any of the money.  so, i also want to make sure that things are financially ready.  even tho i can tell you, i sure dont want a big wedding.  no way.  

relationships of any kind take work.  and when one of the people just dont want to work it out (or are completely controlled and brain washed), then its almost for the best that the relationship burns and crashes instead of lasting a long time, years and years, and then things would get worse.

oiy.  honestly, im not cynical.  just worried about everyone who is or has gone thru this horrid stuff.

have you ever just sat on your bed/chair/couch looking at the room around you with no noise or distractions of any kind?  just you and your eyes viewing and observing all that is around your physical body?  it is weird that in the absense of distractions and with concentration to the point of almost none, the realizations we can discover.  just the chance to have a purely mental view of life.  without the sound, we can almost hear our thoughts.  and without any moving visual stimulation, we can almost see our mind.  and a time such as this allows oneself the opportunity to think to the deepest level.  to think about the simplicity of an act to the complexity of a life.  to delve into the past.  to expand ideas of the future.  you can take one thought and compound it into a million.  and once the thoughts have either multiplied into infinity or condensed into a single one, can then realizations or even questions be made.  an understanding about a path you should take and then questions on how and why.  the concentration to plead about the choices of the past and the future.  to decide what next steps should be placed to walk according to the inner mind.  

it is a chance to think about what we want for ourselves either now or later.  and wants can be possibly transformed into acts.  but first, we must figure out the how.  and many times it is the looming question of how that prevents us from surpassing the fears and doubts we may have.  the inner self teasing, taunting, attacking the heart and sometimes even visa versa.  

now, as i sit there staring about my room, i think of how to change these circling thoughts that are drounding my mind.  conclusions arise but pass as quickly as they came.  and conclusions merge into hopes.  and not just hopes but viewpoints.  and only then, only then when my mind connects with my thoughts, can i fully start to discover, realize, and think.
yay for peta's victory over the circus!
happy new years!  2008 here we come!

time to poke the bear.... hehe...

some of you will understand.  if you dont, no worries.

so, i wonder how many diapers a certain mother goes thru ever day since she obviously has to change her son's diapers since he is a mommas boy thru and thru?  and he is full of shit, so she must go thru a lot!!!

pretty funny thought there, huh?
ive been thinking about this for awhile... should i go into nursing?  advice?
im updating my blog in myspace primarily now.  its easier.  ill write in here some, but the bulk of it will be in there.

im still so lost about my future- meaning both near and far.  i am at such an open ended part in my life that it is confusing and scary.  i know i want to teach, and i know i want animals.  other than that, i dont "know" anything about my future.  and yes, i know thats why it is called "future", but still, life is so open right now.  i could move to tahiti if i wanted.  and no, i dont want to, but i said it to make a point.  i was thinking of going into vet tech stuff, then nursing, then something in medical but ???, and all along tho, i know i want to teach.  but, i can do other things that teaching at the same time.  i would love to do editing stuff.  and the whole thing of where i will live!  i keep thinking nau and then staying in flag because, well, its close to what i know.  but, who knows what the future will bring.  and thats what is crazy!  who knows?!
well thats it for now.  i was going to write something longer, but i am tired.  night!

i love halloween.  its tomorrow!  i dont know what im going to do for it, but i plan on doing something rocking!  i think im going to wear my other halloween costume from a few years ago- the fairy one.  yay for fairies!  and no, not gay fairies, even tho that is fine, too.  i told mike that we could go to a haunted house.  as long as he drives, ill pay.  the thing with all of that is he really wants to go to one and take me to it.  i think a lot of that is due to the fact that i dont want to go with a passion.  oh well.  i want candy and lots of it.  lots of reeces.  yummy!  and those little packages of m&ms.

i just thought that would be a cute subject line. dr jan itor. from scrubs for all of you sad sad people who have not seen scrubs. but, anywho... i got my grade for a class i was taking, and well duh, i got an a. yay! im looking up what classes id like to take for next semester, and i think im going to take 2 dance classes, swimming, anatomy and physiology, sign language (for a review- with the same teacher!), and another teaching course this time about online teaching. why anatomy and physiology you ask? well, other than teaching, im thinking of going into nursing. do that on the side. i know so much about bodies anyways, and im facinated by it all, that it would be a lot of fun. and i could easily teach and do that because everyone knows i like staying busy and having no time for myself. that always seems to be when im happiest. as long as i can read. i need to have enough time to read.
i went to the dr yesterday, and she gave me some good ideas but also took blood work just in case. for the past week ive been very extremely dizzy, really fatigued, bad migraines, sensitivity to temperatures- more than normal, and really sensitive to touch. and no, im not pregnant. (thank god.) these are really broad symptoms and could mean a lot of things, but she's thinking its due to allergies and getting over from being sick sometime. she found fluid behind my eardrums, so thats why she thinks that. she did take blood work just in case there is something else. its been so bad that i havent wanted to drive anywhere because of the dizzy spells being so intense and frequent. ugh!
tonight at work we got to dress up! i dressed up as a black cat. the little kids were getting such a kick out of it. i pretended to be a kitty cat for some of the kiddletts. i love kids' smiles! on wednesday we also get to dress up (since it is halloween), so i am thinking of going as little red riding hood that i was last year. it has a cape! a red cape!

"i broke my other leg"... "springtime for hitler in germany" - the producers
im watching the producers on hbo right now. it is so funny. i love this musical. mel brooks is a genius. i saw it in new york city on broadway, and now it is on hbo. well, it has been for a bit. great musical. if you havent seen it yet, you MUST watch it.
so, work has been going well. since i have worked a few days and i am always on my feet, my back hurts. today i start camera training. i am doing pretty everything there. its great. ive done lobby stuff, sales stuff, and so much other stuff. camera training should be fun today. and ive made friends, too. its a nice job.
i take my GRE tomorrow. oh gosh- im so nervous. im growing up! i hate standardized tests. all they determine is if you can take tests. they suck.
ok thats it for now. there are excerpts of my life right now.

you know, those dolls with the flippy eyes and who talk are just plain ol freaky. they are actually scary. i keep thinking they will attack me in the middle of the night. *shivers*
today i had my first day of work at picture people. i did all lobby work today. it was pretty easy and at times, pretty boring. but, thats how things go. one day is crazy and the next is boring. im going to be doing basically everything there- working printing, lobby, sales, and taking the pics. thats what im looking foward to the most... the photo taking. there were some adorable kiddlets today. its close to halloween time (obviously), and so kids are coming in with their halloween costumes. most of the people are nice, but some people are just so cranky. makes me wonder whats up their butts. but, anywho... its nice having a job i can do. it is physically easy for me, so that is wonderful.
im excited for my halloween party for three reasons: 1) ill get to see my friends again, 2)it a halloween party (enough said!), and 3) adam is coming!!!

my apt needs to be redecorated. i just decided that. i just moved in (in the grand scheme of things), and yet i want to redecorate. maybe because its easier to redec after things are out of boxes. idk. but, i dont know what to do. i just know that i should. or atleast have a plan before i move out of here into my next one. which brings me onto topic two. grad school stuff (yes technical word there) is coming along. its still really freaky. every step farther that i get things done weirds me out even more. it is also such a lengthy and expensive process. $10 for each transcript turned in. $10! and thats only from nau. i have 9, count it 9, other transcripts to turn in. ahhhh!
so yesterday was a totally rockin awesome funness day filled with pumpkins! dad and i went to schnepf farms in queek creek for the pumpkin festival. dad and i went mini golfing in the cute little course they had set up, went on a hay ride, fed deer, got completely lost in a 10 acre maze, ate some yummy food, and picked 2 nice pumpkins. it was so much fun. i got completely covered in dirt, deer spit, and coffee i spilt on myself earlier in the day. it was so much fun!
tonight i have an audition for a community theater musical. im nervous. i havent audition for anything in a long time. im so nervous.

so im bummed.  why you ask?  it seems that more and more people are happily in love and getting engaged and married.  good for them, yes, but at the same time, it reminds me of when i was engaged and almost married.  which is to be a soon 2 months away.  and even though i am extremely glad that i did not marry him, i still cant help but feel saddness.  not for him, but just for the fact i was almost going to have a beautiful wedding.  a wedding is a big thing for a girl.  and i guess its just hard seeing all of these very happy pictures of loving couples.  yes, i am in a relationship of which i am very happy about.  it is still tough, though.  kind of has me bummed out.

so things have been the least bit from not interesting. that means things have been very very interesting and complicated and just plain ol' stressing mostly. my depression has sucked, dissociation has sucked but luckily i havent heard voices, have had many interesting encounters with people, decided to be in a relationship yet its long distance (and no not the asshole), got a job at a photo studio, and right now am sick with the flu. today was supposed to be my first day, and of course i am sick as a, well what is a good example, ummm, evil germ bug. yesterday i was unbelievably tired, and i think that was a warning i was going to get sick. i think being sick is from too much stress. atleast right now i am watching one of my favorite scrubs if not my favorite. its the wizard of oz one.
ok, so you are probably wondering why i am in a relationship again. he is a really sweet guy, and we get along really well. it sucks he lives in washington dc, but we are going to try to make it work. interesting, huh?
thats enough for now. im tired.

there is a really good chance i may have a job at a family portrait photo studio.  i had my interview tonight, and the manager said that she would hire me right then, but she has to call one of my references for the application process.  but, she said that she really likes me and thinks id be perfect for the job.  so, she said she'd call monday between 2 and 3 pm and tell me when i can start.  yay!  i am loving photography, so this would be fun to be constantly surrounded in it.  and talking about photography... i took a roll of film on sunday (a week ago), and i thought that the pics would turn out awesome.  so, i developed the roll, and to my suprise, nothing came out.  it turns out that the film did not even go thru the camera.  ha!

yes that is correct folks. allergies do suck. when dad and i were dusting my apt, my allergies started declaring hell upon my entire body. i think there must have been some pollen that was with dust that got kicked up into the air when we dusted. i had those stargazer lillies awhile ago, and i discovered that i was allergic (badly) to them. so the pollen left over was probably on the stuff we dusted. so, now my body itches, eyes are swollen and itchy, and my throat is annoyed. it was really bad before, and so i took a clartin and took a long long shower, and that helped. but, dad and i just went over to clark's, and he had a fire going outside. and obviously fires have smoke which of course went into my eyes hence causing allergies to suck again.
the reason for the dusting... dad bought me a new tv! 24 inches of correctly colored people. ah, correctly colored people you ask? well, my other one was turning people green. to be more exact, over a third of my tv screen had a green tint. it was old. well, actually it was leif's, so who knows how good of care he kept it. so, we had to dust the old tv and the place the new tv is going, so that is how the dust happened. but, i love my new tv! its so big! the other one was 14 inches. this is 24 inches! its huge! and now from my desk i can read things on the screen (like tivo and such).
so, the tv is the big and exciting news of the day. other than that, my life is a roller coaster of events, emotions, and such.
and the best news of all... THE DBACKS ARE DIVISION CHAMPS AND ARE GOING TO THE PLAYOFFS!!!

so suprisingly i havent felt like writing anything. which probably isnt the best in the grand scheme of things, but tough phooey. a lot has been going on in the world of katie, just to say the least. i saw one of my best friends last week. bri came from san diego for a conference in goodyear, and then he stayed with me for 2 days. last weekend i went up to flag to visit friends. i only saw cody and sam, but it was worth it. i forgot how much i missed my cody until i was with him. (insert tear here- wait did i spell tear right? oh well.) overall, it was a nice weekend, but it was also bumming at the same time. i realized that i dont fit in flag anymore. and i dont feel i fit in here in phx. dad says that not fitting in flag is due to not being in college right now, and i sure hope he is right. but anywho... it wasnt as hard as i thought it would be also on the leif front. i thought it would be terribly hard to go back up to flag again bc of all the wasted memories. suprisingly, tho, it wasnt. then again, i have no respect for him anymore, so i guess that could be a big reason. oh, and another thing awesome- a friend who i havent talked to in about 4 years gave me a call the other day! we've been friends for like 7 or 8 ish years, and we just lost touch. how cool is talking to him again! yay for myspace.
ok, what else... photography is going well. i couldnt go to class last night which was a big bummer. but, there was a darn good reason (of which i dont feel like going into). so, now i have to finish my project wednesday before class. thats not that big of a deal tho. oh, and its finally starting to cool down here in phx, so tennis class wont be as bad heat wise, and maybe dad and i can actually start practicing!
ok, thats enough for now. have a great day!
i come from the land down under.  where the women glow and men plunder

photography is sooo cool!  i absolutely love it and am totally addicted to it.

and, my halloween party is october 27th.  mark your calendars.

im not going to have my halloween party this year. ive had one for 4 years, and i wanted to have one this year, but no one will say they will come for sure. im not going thru all that work and have no one come. and you all know that when i plan the halloween party, its big. and this is one thing every year i look foward to the most. but, since people wont say they will come for sure and keep giving me lame excuses why, then im not doing it. i can understand if you have to work or are sick or such, but most of you i do not agree with the money thing. if you are coming from flag, it costs a frackin $25. if you are in phx, it doesnt cost anything! and honestly, it hurts when i hear that people wont come bc of money but then are spending hundreds on other things- like halloween costumes. i have felt so lonely since i moved to phx. my life was upturned in a second. and i find it really hard here. other than my dad who makes it atleast a little bareble, i hate it here. so, im not doing the party- of which i love- unless i know that people will come. and its a saturday night for goodness sakes! october 27th!
thing two... i told you all that the time when i was supposed to get married in december is going to be hard for me. even though ive moved on and am over him, still. it will hurt. i dont want it to, but marriage and pledging your entire life to someone is big. and having that taken away is hard. and the date of the wedding is going to be really hard. most of you cant understand, but atleast symphathize. so, i really need my friends around me during that time. and i need to do something big and fun to keep my mind off of this. and this idea was something many people suggested to me including my psychologist i am seeing for this stupid relationship crap. so, i thought vegas. if we all share a room or two, it will be cheap. and its close so we dont need a plane. and it isnt hard to budget your money. dad is helping with my rent, but other than that, i am living off of only $400 a month. yet i can budget and afford this. some of you, yes i understand. but most of you i am getting the whole money thing and then you go buy something frackin elaborate for a lot of money. or you say that you arent sure if you can come bc you might do something else then. i feel that friendship is a two way street. i give so much, but after hearing all of this, it hurts. honestly it does. i feel so isolated from everyone and so lonely. and when no one will agree to spending time with me during a time that is really hard for me, it makes me doubt or wonder about friendship. there are only two times in the whole year i ask for friendship. and yet, i am really suprised by the lack of support i am getting.
i thought id tell everyone how i am feeling. and this does not apply to everyone. the people who live down here in phx are good. basically this is for flag people. do what you want with this letter.

well, i havent written in a few days.  lets see lets see lets see...  dad and i went to "as you wish" which is a pottery painting place.  it was so much fun.  dad painted a fish, and i painted a pumpkin and small penguin.  it was nice to do something different.  and yesterday was teddy bear day.  it actually was national teddy bear day.  dad, clark, ruth, and i went to downtown glendale for it.  it was so much fun!  i got a few different things.  nothing can beat a teddy bear.  well, maybe except chocolate.  i am still unpacking.  yes i know, its been 2 and 1/2 months since ive lived here.  but, remember, i hate hate hate unpacking.  and packing, too, but right now i am unpacking.  and in my defense, some of my stuff has been at dad's.  ok, so that is basically what has been going on in the life of katie.

ugh.  i dont want to be working on my class right now.  my edu250 class just started, and i need to work on it, but i just dont feel like it.  i have to proof more of the powerpoint class, but bingo- i dont want to.  and, i have to grade, but nope- dont want to.  ever had one of those days where you just dont feel like doing anything?  thats one sucky thing about working at home.  its too easy to procrastinate.  and the reason i am procrastinating... my back is absolutely killing me.  ugh.  stupid back.  you know- i wish the drs would finally invent a titatium back that could just be put in my back already and i wouldnt have to deal with this damn pain and the constant fear i am going to hurt it.  i couldnt even sleep last night.  it was so frustrating.  mike was sleeping so peacefully next to me, but i couldnt fall asleep.  and i didnt want to wake him because of how cute he was.  he sure is fun to be around though.  him sleeping next to me made my frustration of not being able to sleep less.  still- damn back!
there were giant penguins as tall as 5 feet that lived in peru 40 million years ago!  isnt that awesome!  giant penguins!

yes folks, it is true.  val is crazy.  last night she was attacking my flip flops, and tonight she was attacking my tennis shoes.  and now she is cuddling me.  about 20 mins ago she was running like a crazy thing around the apt.  i wonder what is going on in her head.  mike asked me last night why she does what she does.  if i knew, i would write a book and make a lot of money.   he loves val though.  he is always cuddling her, and the cute thing is she seems to love him, too!  its always a good thing when your animals like someone.  the bunnies are so precious.  gizzy likes to eat the hay out of martin's cage.  and lassie and gizzy sit on top of eachother to get to the water bottle.  i have a crazy apt!


i had my first tennis class tonight.  oh my gosh is it hard!  when you look at tennis, you think its an easy sport.  but holy cow its not.  and its even harder for me since everything with softball is automatic.  however, tennis is opposite of softball.  so, basically, i suck.  badly.  its going to be a lot of practice for me.  and i think its almost harder to do everything wrong than right.  i got so much excersise.  its always nice when i am all sweaty and dirty from excersising.  of course i take a shower after.  but still, its nice to be hurting from excersise.  my back and ankle are killing me.  i had to take 2 vicadin just for the horrid sharpness to go away.  but atleast it is hurting from doing something productive.  i need to practice- definately.  tennis rocks!

hopefully i should hear back from midwestern university soon.  i really want the job.  its perfect for me.  ok thats enough for now.  i miss everyone i havent seen in a while, and for those i have seen recently, i miss you, too.

arrrrr... i love pirates.  pirates rock.

so ive been busy with classes.  well, technically class, so far.  but this photo class is going to make me really busy.  its going to be a lot of work.  but thats ok.  i can deal with that even tho i am stressed right now.  i have a job interview tomorrow.  ugh.  interviews always really stress me out.  and i dont need that.  but i want the job, so thats a plus.  i still have yet to hear from midwestern, but that is because they arent done with interviews.  i really want that job.  that would be a fun job and perfect for me.  i guess ill know soon.

so i almost lost and then did lose my voice today.  ive been coughing a lot and i have a lot of snot around my vocal cords.  so, losing my voice makes sense.  ive, for some reason, had the dire want to sing.  and, well, when you have a scratchy voice or are losing your voice, you definately dont want to sing.  you can completely ruin your voice.  and, i really really really dont want to do that.  its annoying to have allergies.  i figured out that i am allergic to the stargazer lillies that i have in my apt.  even though dad cut off the pollen, it is all around my apt.  oh, and that reminds me that i should open the window.  ooh it smells nice in here now.  there is nothing like fresh air to make you feel better.

 

so i have a lot on my mind lately.  stuff about leif, about my mom, my family, and about life.  i feel overwhelmed at times.  i was talking to dad on the phone while i was at gcc in the student union, and tears started coming to my eyes.  (and its nothing that i really feel like talking about to anyone else.)  i just have things to work out, and it will take time.  im going to a counselor, and he is helping, but it is still hard at times.  and its not just about leif anymore.  my mind is starting to go back on the other crap.  ugh.  but it is still on leif at times.

 

i have been successful at losing weight.  my clothes are getting looser.  i still have more weight i want to lose, and then i will have to be careful to keep it off, but especially living alone i dont eat as much and as often. 

 

(insert sanford and son theme song here)

im watching "take the lead", and gosh is it sexy.  i want to learn how to dance those dances.  it would be so much fun!  i miss dancing.  i feel so frumpy right now.  im not dancing.  tennis hasnt started yet.  i cant go out and run because its too dang hot.  ugh.


i have my photography class again tomorrow night, yet i still havent gotten the book.  it hasnt been in the college bookstores.  i have to have 5 chapters read by tomorrow's class.  yikes!  but i think it might be at barnes and noble, so ill definately be checking it out there.  and anyways, its always good to have a trip to barnes and noble.  other than that, ive written down all the big stuff that has been going on.

the diamondbacks rock!  im watching the game right now.  just an fyi.


ive gotten a lot done today even though it doesnt seem so.  i got the dishes done and put away, dishes put away from inside the dishwasher, made dinner, got groceries, and put away ALL of my clothes that were in boxes.  now, that took a long time.  and from all the bending, my back hurts now.  dad and i were going to go see a movie today, but i had way too much stuff to do, so we didnt.  atleast i got a lot of it done.  maybe movie tomorrow.  i even still have to grade tonight.  ugh.  so much to do and so little time.


im glad tomorrow is sunday for one reason...  sunday newspaper.  i love the coupons!  i know i sound like a dork, but they really help save money.  my grocery bill is really down now that i live alone.  i can live off of like $30 a month just all by myself!  i dont like leftovers much, and mike likes them, so he finishes them.  he loves the leftovers. 

 

thats it for now.  god bless.

im weird today.  i feel lonely even though i am not the least bit.  i have amazing friends, an amazing dad, amazing pets, and people who i love.  however, today for some reason, i cant help but feel sad about the past and what has happened.  i dont know why.  dad said that sometimes the littlest things can bring back a flood of memories.  maybe its applying for grad school which we were doing together.  maybe it was the song "overkill" on scrubs last night.  i just feel sad i guess.  i feel sad about what has happened.

i thought that quote was a good one.  and it sure applies to life.  and, of course, bucky rocks!

anywho, my photography class sounds like it is going to be fun.  its going to be expensive, alas, but fun.  we only had class for like 30min to an hour on monday, but thats because barely anyone actually had what they needed yet.  luckily i already have my camera, so that wont be an expense.  just the expensive things will be film, paper, and stuff like that.  i have the class again tonight.  and i have my tennis class that i am taking with dad tomorrow night.  its after the sun goes down, so itll be like a degree cooler.  yippee for a degree.  (sarcastic if you couldnt tell.)

so i decided that my friends and i are going to vegas in december.  thats when i was supposed to get married.  even though im moving on with my life and he is showing me that he doesnt respect me and so how can i care about someone who doesnt respect me, still.  its going to be a tough time then.  so, i want to go somewhere and live it up!  totally forget about what was supposed to be.  and i decided vegas because its close, cheap, and you dont need plane tickets to go.  if we all share a room or two, itll be cheaper.  i need all my friends around me during then, so its a good idea.  so, tough luck if you are thinking of going anywhere during then.  you are coming with me!  ha!

thats it for now sweets.  god bless.

it has been a long day.  a very long day.  the number date of today sucked.  really truely sucked.  but, i hung around dad and other people, and it helped pick me up.  i went out to lunch at uno's, startbucks, took a nap, went to dairy queen for a chocolate covered ice cream cone, and went to the grocery store.  the rest of the night i have been on peta's website.  ive learned a lot from that site.  most of it makes me cry.  the stuff that doesnt are the ways that i can help stop all of that evil from happening.  the site has really opened my eyes.  im so glad that i am a vegetarian. 

 

but other than that, lets see...  i start my classes tomorrow night.  that should be fun.  photography, tennis, and two education classes.  im excited to take more classes.  yes, i graduated from college, yet i am taking more classes.  and no, this isnt going towards any sort of degree.  in a year, school will go toward my masters degree.  but for now, i am a dork who is taking college classes for fun on my free time.  thats about it!

thats how i feel right now.  the past week has been full of stress because of certain specific memorable (or should have been) dates, frustration with my back, and other crap.  today i am sick.  im hoping alicia can cover my shift, but she hasnt awoken yet.  i covered hers on wednesday, so if she works tonight, then she can make up that money.  see- its a win win situation.  i dont puke on people, and she makes money.  im hoping in a few hours and a few vicadin ill feel better.  i hate how stress can do this to you.  it sucks.  majorly.  grrrrr...

today was insane!  so insane!  so busy!  my feet are killing me.  this opening of the restraunt was so busy.  people were waiting outside even before we opened.  i had some good tables.  but, i did have a few cranky people.  i got stiffed with one tip by almost $8!  can you believe that!  but i did make $55.  thats pretty good for this being my first time ever serving.

"my inner peace is thinking of tearing your inner peace into tiny pieces."- bucky 
that one was way too good to not quote today.  that was the get fuzzy for today.  hehehehe. 
2 months as of tomorrow.  its been a tough day today, and i know it wont be any easier tomorrow.  atleast i am working like crazy tomorrow, so that will keep my mind on something else.

today was nice.  i was very refreshing having a day off.  even though ive just started working, it feels like years that ive been running thru this job.  i am very overwhelemed.  there is just so much to remember!  the only thing i am worried about is carrying the trays.  but it was very nice having a day off.  im going to be working straight for a while.  i had an eye dr apt today.  ill be getting my new lenses in about a week.  yay!  and i went to victorias secret for stuff, the disney store for a mickey poster, safeway for my pills and stuff, and the post office.  and now i have been relaxing, taking care of stuff on the computer, hanging things on walls, brushing kitty, and stuff like that.  i need to go to sleep soon because i have work tomorrow early, and im going to read before sleeping.  ive been reading every night before i go to bed.  it is really nice to be able to do that again.  and right now i have a kitty laying next to me.  life is good right now.  as good as it can be regarding the circumstances.  ok, thats enough right now.  god bless!

so the past two days have been busy!  i am so overwhelemed with work.  there is just so much to remember!  today we went over all the alcohol and mixed drinks (which involves alcohol), and there is a lot.  it would have probably helped if i knew what things were alcohol and what werent instead of constantly having to ask.  im not doing bartending, but with my luck, someone would ask me if a certain ingredient is alcoholic or not.  but, one of the fun things we did was learning about what serving at dinner is composed of.  and then the best was, of course, the food tasting.  yesterday and today they brought out a third of the menu for us to try.  but what made things great about today was the tiramasu.  oh yeah!  i loveee tiramasu.  

i have come to the conclusion that my bed is too big for me.  i have a lot of pillows and val cuddles, but these past 2 months have just shown me how big my bed is.  i figured that it would have gotten atleast some what easier, but it hasnt yet.  even getting ready for bed still feels really weird.  no, not the getting ready for bed part.  the alone part.  i figured a lot of this stuff would have been getting easier.  nope.  and it feels so lonely coming home to an empty home.  i have the animals here, so it isnt technically empty, but it feels empty coming home to a house without another person here.  time, time, time...

today was another day of errands.  i got another pair of black pants for work- a suggestion of dad's.  he suggested that in case i get one pair dirty and have to work directly the next day and cant wash the dirty ones, then i have a clean pair.  good idea, huh?  and while dad and i were in the store (new york and co), i saw this beautiful dress, and it looked awesome on me.  so dad bought it for me.  how sweet!  

in the froot of the loom commercials, what is the leafy character supposed to be?  i get the grapes and apple and such, but he's just all covered in leaves.  that doesnt make sense.  hmmm...

more and more is getting unpacked in here.  and we put some stuff up on the walls- pics and shelves.  its weird how big it is in here even with all my stuff.  since boxes are actually leaving the apt now, i have a lot of floor space.  well, except for my bedroom.  a lot of boxes just recently went in there.  all clothes.  i have a lot of clothes.  

other than that, i am just keeping very busy.  i have a lot to do, and i want to make sure that i keep busy.  its easy to let my mind wander and emotions come back to me.  and that just is not good.

god bless.

yes, that is correct dear friends.  you will be given a scrubs quote every day (ish) for a long time.  today i watched like 4 scrubs as i unpacked and such.  now, things are cleaner in the kitchen and family room but way more crowded and unorganized in my bedroom.  i really doubt i will ever have this whole place unpacked by the time i leave.  since i know i am only going to be here for a year, it almost seems pointless.  but, then again, i should unpack because itll make it seem more like home, ill be able to find things, ill be able to go thru and see what i dont want/ need, and i just should.  ugh i hate the word "should".  but anywho...  dad put up two shelves today, so i will be able to put up a few figure things of mine.  im not really hanging/ putting much on the walls.  i wont be here for long, and every time that dad and i start placing things on the walls, i get sentimental.  it will get done.  just very slooowwwlllyyy...  and hey, i have time.  i have 11 months now.  i just hate unpacking.  its annoying.  i should get it done soon, though, considering ill be wayyy busy once work and classes start.  im excited for classes to start.  im taking things ive always wanted to take.  so its going to be fun.  and hey, i like school.  well i like it when i am healthy or atleast not in the er or on crutches.  lol!

today was the day of errands.  petco, petsmart, staples, target, olive garden, wildflower bread company, and safeway.  many many errands.  even though it was frackin hot out, it was nice to go running around.  i got my apron, tie, and money pouch for olive garden.  i get to learn how to tie a tie now.  dad is going to teach me.  and i needed more hay for the bunnies.  they wholf that stuff down!  especially martin.  he is mimiking the other bunnies.  its adorable. 

so i have so much to memorize for olive garden.  i have the menu, the alcohol, and everything in between.  ill definately be studying this weekend!  i want to do the best i can in this job.  yeah, its not in my field, but its a job, and i want to do the absolute best.  so learning the menu, ill be!  in between unpacking that is.  lol!

and i know that sounds bad since i myself am i woman, but i cant help but to be frustrated with women at this point.  with all this leif crap, and now with stuff with the apartment complex, that i think i need to go somewhere totally away from people all together.  because people are just really pissing me off right now.  and im not able to stay silent anymore and let crap run over me.  im pissed.   

just an fyi.

ok, so i just got rid of the last entry.  too many people who i did not know were writing crap, and i just didnt want to deal with hearing any more of it.  and that david h kid wrote back who only wrote to say mean things to cody during his break up, and he does not know me or anyone involved, so once he started writing interfereing in what he does not know what is going on, i just changed the entry to being private.  ugh.

but, anywho...  my electricity bill is a whopping $112!  oh my gosh!  thats so much money.  yikes!  its the air conditioning, i think.  well, that would be the most reasonable thing.  i have to keep it not sweltering hot in here because of the animals, though.  and yes, for my own well being.  katie gets cranky when she is too hot.  i dont even want to see my qwest bill.  i will have two months i will be paying for this bill.  and each month is like $110 itself.  even if i had "enough" money, it would never seem like enough.  it just seems that finances are one thing to easily stress me out.  at times that is.  and right now things are looking up since i just got a job.

which about the job!  i start my first day of orientation tomorrow.  yay!  ill get to meet people.  and have a place to go during the days other than school, errands, and other stuff like that.  but going to work again will be nice.  it was nice to get to go with dad to his night classes.  ooh and my night classes start soon!  itll be nice to take classes about things that ive always wanted to take but never have had the chance.  

other than that, same ol same ol.  my allergies are annoying during the monsoon season.  but, i went running last night.  ran until i could barely walk.  it felt nice.  i havent been able to run in so long, so it was great.  yeah, it wasnt very long, but it was the longest that ive ran in a long time.  im sore today.

god bless.

if you dont want to talk to me, get the balls to call.  dont have your mom or anyone else threaten me with sueing me or calling me bitchy names.  (in my opinion)  if YOU dont want to talk, then call.

i dont believe in the slightest way that i have been the reason for all of this.  if you dont want to hear from me, then call.  dont have other people do it for you.  and regarding the baby- i was pregnant, but when i fell off the bed because of the seizure, i mis-carried.  dont have people go calling me names thinking i was lying. 

last time we talked, we decided to stay engaged.  so it is natural and NORMAL when people think they are engaged to call and write.  

sorry to the rest of you for having to read all this crap.

ok, so another update on a happier subject. i finally got a job! yay! i am going to be a server at olive garden. it's not a job in education, but still, it's a job. it'll give me money that i need and a chance to meet people which is another thing i desperately need. its weird living down in phoenix and knowing primarily older adults. i know just a handful of people my age, and everyone is busy. it also gets pretty lonely when the only person i spend my days with is my dad. i love my dad, but i need to be with more than one person every day. it'll be nice having a place to go every day, get to see people, and get to do more than unpack and read. im excited for my job, though. i've worked at two restraunts before for a short time, so i am slightly familiar with things. this is my first time that i will have ever served. talk about money, baby! oh yeah! but, anywho... this is the olive garden over at happy valley and i-17 and is brand new. it hasnt opened yet, even. i am going to be one of the first staff members! it is so beautiful inside. and huge! ive never seen an olive garden that beautiful before. so, things are looking up. finally. this has been the worst month and a half of my life. 


last night sucked.  i turned on my dishwasher for the first time, and after about 3 minutes, water came jetting out of the dishwasher and the sink completely filling my tile floor, getting all over the top of the counters, and soaking the carpet.  it took me a good 30 minutes to mop up all the water in a small area on the tile!  i called the maintence guy with this emergency, and since things were almost dry for the time being, he said to not turn on any of the water in the kitchen, and he'll come over tomorrow (which was today).  it turns out that there was a leak in the piping under my sink, and so he just had to replace it.  it was an adventure, though.  


i completely broke down last night after all of this happened.  last night, that was.  this past month and a half has been horrible, and it just seemed like things just kept getting worse.  im strong, but a person can only take so much!  after talking to dad, i felt better, but it was a hard night.  today showed me that things are starting to look up.  i have a job, so that is a good thing.  nothing will ever stop me, no matter how bad, but it can get tough on me.  i am super strong, though.  i can handle it.  all of it.

it was awesome! totally awesome! it was so weird to see the characters on the big screen. they were huge! probably the best part of the movie was "spider pig". (seen the previews and you'll understand.) and before hand was probably the most fun ive ever had waiting for a movie. they let us in the theater at 11pm. two guys brought three beach balls, so we were hitting them around like in a stadium. and there were so many of us that it was great. and this one guy started a round and the wave. it was so much fun! all of you have to see the movie!


on another note, i want and need at this point to talk to leif. there is just so much going on in my head and heart that i think i am going to go crazy at this point. and one thing people dont understand, well one person in particular, is that i am a strong woman who is not to be messed with. i was watching "monster in law," and it reminded me so much of the situation going on. "i want him to be happy" always seems to be the reason mother in laws give for destroying their son's relationships. they are happy! why cant parents just let their kids go on with their lives and not interfere? why cant they understand that interfering in the kid's lives is making things worse in many ways? it may seem as though you are "helping," but the best way to help is support them, not tell them what to do, and let them make decisions for themselves. my mom controlled me most of my life, and she thought she was doing what was "right" for me. when i had a breakup with a guy, she didnt let me talk to him after and pounded it into my mind that i shouldnt. but, thru time i realized that it was important to talk after and clear the air. and there were relationships that i wanted to work thru the problems and get back together, but she would not let me. she would monitor my phone calls. and back then i wasnt into email. and she thought it was all for my own "good" since i would complain and bitch at times. it actually hurt way worse and made things way worse because of the fact she wouldnt let me do what i knew i needed to do.  and the thing is, thats what is going on here.  (in my opinion.)  i just wish that he would stand up for himself and me and us.  he is a very smart, confident, wonderful man who does know what he should do without anyone telling him to do.  and he needs to understand that he can make decisions for himself, and the decision to marry me was the right thing.  and im not telling him what to do here.  i just want him to know that he did make the right decision and doesnt have to doubt that.  he made the decision a long time ago, and even though things may be hard right now on figuring out the future, he knows in his heart that we are meant to be together.  the heart always knows what it wants.


and on another note, i had another job interview today at olive garden.  i have a second interview tomorrow.  i think i did really well and have a good shot at the job.  im frustrated that ive applied for over 60 edu jobs and have only gotten 3 calls back.  2 of which were not right.  ugh!

in my opinion...  i might be taking a pause to write in here for a small bit.  it just all depends.  currently, in my opinion, i am possibly facing charges of libel because of things i have written in my livejournal for a certain person who, in my opinion, hates me.  anything i have written in here has been all opinion, and whenever i may have said something mean, it was just me getting out of my frustration of the past happenings.  in my opinion... everything has been my opinion.  and being charged for libel because of opinions can not, in my opinion, happen.  you know what, screw it.  im not letting someone who, in my opinion, hates me to stop me from doing one thing i love that is giving me solice throughout this time.  ha.
